intro: Astragalus stevenianus subsp. jodostachys, commonly known as the Jodostachys milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitats. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is often found in dry steppe and desert environments.
